metadata.title: CVE-2021-47442 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: NFC:digital: fix possible memory leak in digital_in_send_sdd_req() 'skb' isallocated in digital_in_send_sdd_req(), but not free whendigital_in_send_cmd() failed, which will cause memory leak. Fix it byfreeing 'skb' if digital_in_send_cmd() return failed.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-166.174~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1118.125~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1129.142~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1114.128~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1085.93~16.04.1').
